contentrichtext.text: {{Use mdy dates|date=February 2012}} {{Infobox dam |dam_name=Wells Dam |image=Wellsdam-bpa.jpg |caption= |official_name= |crosses=[[Columbia River]] |reservoir=[[Lake Pateros]] |locale= [[Chelan County, Washington|Chelan]] / [[Douglas County, Washington|Douglas]] counties, [[Washington (U.S. state)|Washington]] |maint=[[Douglas County Public Utility District]] |length= |height= |width= |began= |open=August 22, 1967 |closed= |cost= |reservoir_capacity={{convert|331200|acre feet|km3|abbr=on}} |reservoir_catchment= |reservoir_surface= |turbines= 10 <ref>http://www.eia.doe.gov/cneaf/electricity/page/capacity/capacity.html</ref> |installed_capacity= 851.4 MW <ref>http://www.eia.doe.gov/cneaf/electricity/page/capacity/capacity.html</ref> |max_capacity= |annual_generation= |bridge_carries= |bridge_width= |bridge_clearance= |bridge_traffic= |bridge_toll= |bridge_id= |map_cue= |map_image= |map_text= |map_width= |coordinates={{coord|47|56|43.44|N|119|51|57.6|W|type:landmark_region:US|display=inline}} |lat= |long= |extra= }} '''Wells Dam''' is a [[Hydroelectricity|hydroelectric]] dam located on the [[Columbia River]], downstream from the confluence of the [[Okanogan River]], [[Methow River]], and the Columbia River in [[Washington (U.S. state)|Washington State]]. The dam, associated structures, and machinery make up the Wells Hydroelectric Project. It is owned and operated by [[Douglas County Public Utility District]]. [[Image:Wells Dam from Azwell WA.jpg|thumb|left|The yellow cranes and other equipment are part of Wells Dam]] [[File:Columbia River - Wells Dam aerial 01A.jpg|thumb|left|Aerial view]] It has produced electricity since August 22, 1967. Its operating license from the US [[Federal Energy Regulatory Commission]] is next up for renewal in 2012. In addition to the two public utility districts, the project provides electricity to [[Puget Sound Energy]], [[Portland General Electric]], [[PacifiCorp]], [[Avista Corporation]], and the Colville Indian Tribe.<ref>http://www.fwee.org/news/getStory?story=1309</ref> Its reservoir is named [[Lake Pateros]]. Just below and adjacent is [[Carpenter Island]] boat launch and fish hatchery river access. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Columbia River dams |dam=Wells Dam| downriver=[[Rocky Reach Dam]]|upriver=[[Chief Joseph Dam]]}} {{Crossings navbox |structure = [[List of crossings of the Columbia River|Crossings]] |place = [[Columbia River]] |bridge = Wells Dam |bridge signs = |upstream = [[Brewster Bridge]] |upstream signs = |downstream = [[Beebe Bridge]] |downstream signs = }} [[Category:Buildings and structures in Chelan County, Washington]] [[Category:Dams on the Columbia River]] [[Category:Dams in Washington (state)]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Douglas County, Washington]] [[Category:Hydroelectric power plants in Washington (state)]] [[Category:United States local public utility dams]] [[Category:Dams completed in 1967]] [[Category:Energy infrastructure completed in 1967]] [[Category:Gravity dams]]
